Sentence.sentence: If you look at a lot of low-income communities in the United States, there are programs that are serving them, but they're primarily centered around ‘Let's get these kids' grades up,' and not around ‘Let's get these kids access to the same kinds of opportunities as more-affluent kids,' said Daniel Zaharopol, the founder and executive director of the program.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In other words, structural unemployment is a fake problem, which mainly serves as an excuse for not pursuing real solutions.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Furthermore, the issue is not just how the team can function more effectively, but how it integrates with the overall organization, or society that it supposes it serves.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Still, at the most selective schools, where thousands of candidates may submit identically high grades and test scores, a marginal item like the essay may serve as a tie-breaker between two equally qualified candidates.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: They will serve as modem Magellans, mapping out the solar system for whatever explorers follow, whether man or machine
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: My grandfather served in World War II, and I hope to be just like him someday.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Smith's book serves as an excellent introduction to a vast subject, and will suggest plenty of further
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It serves as a guide to arts and commerce
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Corporations in Germany realized that there was an interest to be served economically and patriotically in building up a skilled labor force at home; we never had that ethos (风气)," says Richard Sennett, a New York University sociologist who has written about the connection of craft and culture.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The plant's carbon-capture technologies would serve as a pilot project for other new coal-burning plants.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Google claims its plan for the world's biggest online library is to serve the interest of the general public.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: to serve the interest of the general public
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: We think it serves them right for being mean to other people.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Esperanto is an artificial language, designed to serve internationally as an auxiliary means of communication among speakers of different languages.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Basically we turned our skin darker to serve as a natural sun protector in the place of the hair we lost.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Le Bohec said:"The plight of the king penguin should serve as a warning about the future of the entire marine environment in the Antarctic."
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Robots capable of social engagement help with loneliness as well as cognitive functioning, but the robot itself doesn't have to engage directly—it can serve as an intermediary for human communication.

sentences.en: Computers have also begun serving agriculture.
sentences.cn: 计算机也开始为农业服务了。

sentences.en: The company will serve a meal at noon to all staff workers.
sentences.cn: 该公司将为所有职员提供午餐。

sentences.en: The restaurant serves nice food.
sentences.cn: 这家饭馆供应的饭菜不错。

sentences.en: She served two years in prison for theft.
sentences.cn: 她因偷窃服了两年刑。

lj.lj_ly: it would serve you right if Jeff walked out on you.
lj.lj_ls: 如果杰夫离你而去的话，那你活该。

jx.jx_en_mean: (主美亦作 serve out one's time)hold office for the normal period
take orders from two superiors or follow two conflicting or opposing principles or policies at the same time
jx.jx_cn_mean: 侍二主，听命于两个原则相左的上级

jx.jx_en_mean: (Tennis)win the final game of a set or match while serving
jx.jx_cn_mean: (网球)发球赢得一局的最后一场

lj.lj_ly: Fitzgerald then served out for the set.
lj.lj_ls: 费茨杰拉德本局最后一场凭发球取胜。

jx.jx_en_mean: To be deserved under the circumstances
jx.jx_cn_mean: 应得：在某些条件下应该

lj.lj_ly: Punish him; it will serve him right for what he has done to you.
lj.lj_ls: 惩罚他；考虑到他对你的所做所为这样对他是他罪有应得

entry.def: If you serve your country, an organization, or a person, you do useful work for them.

example.ex: It is unfair to soldiers who have served their country well for many years...
example.tran: 这对那些为国效忠多年的士兵们来说是不公平的。

example.ex: I have always said that I would serve the Party in any way it felt appropriate.
example.tran: 我一直说，只要需要，我愿意为党效力，不管以何种方式。

entry.def: If you serve in a particular place or as a particular official, you perform official duties, especially in the armed forces, as a civil servant, or as a politician.
entry.tran: (尤指在部队)服役;(在政府部门)任职

example.ex: During the second world war he served with RAF Coastal Command...
example.tran: 二战期间他在英国皇家空军海防总队服役。

example.ex: He also served on the National Front's national executive committee...
example.tran: 他还曾就职于民族阵线全国执行委员会。

entry.def: If something serves as a particular thing or serves a particular purpose, it performs a particular function, which is often not its intended function.

example.ex: She ushered me into the front room, which served as her office...
example.tran: 她把我领进了她用作办公室的前厅。

example.ex: I really do not think that an inquiry would serve any useful purpose...
example.tran: 我真的认为调查没有任何实际意义。

entry.def: If something serves people or an area, it provides them with something that they need.
entry.tran: 供应(某地或某人);为…提供服务

example.ex: This could mean the closure of thousands of small businesses which serve the community...
example.tran: 这可能意味着成千上万家服务社会的小企业将要倒闭。

example.ex: ...improvements in the public water-supply system serving the Nairobi area...
example.tran: 内罗毕地区的公共供水系统的改善

entry.def: Something that serves someone's interests benefits them.
entry.tran: 对…有用;能满足…的需要;符合…的利益

example.ex: The economy should be organized to serve the interests of all the people...
example.tran: 经济的组织运行应符合所有人的利益。

example.ex: They may well decide that their interests would be best served by joining in.
example.tran: 他们很有可能认定参与其中才会令其利益最大化。

entry.def: When you serve food and drink, you give people food and drink.

example.ex: Serve it with French bread...
example.tran: 把它和法式面包一起端上去。

example.ex: Serve the cakes warm...
example.tran: 趁热上蛋糕。

entry.def: Serve is used to indicate how much food a recipe produces. For example, a recipe that serves six provides enough food for six people.

example.ex: Garnish with fresh herbs. Serves 4.
example.tran: 配以新鲜香草，4 人份。

entry.def: Someone who serves customers in a shop or a bar helps them and provides them with what they want to buy.

example.ex: They wouldn't serve me in any pubs 'cos I looked too young...
example.tran: 这些酒吧都不让我进，因为我看上去太小了。

example.ex: Auntie and Uncle suggested she serve in the shop.
example.tran: 阿姨和叔叔建议她去商店工作。

entry.def: When the police or other officials serve someone with a legal order or serve an order on them, they give or send the legal order to them.

example.ex: Immigration officers tried to serve her with a deportation order...
example.tran: 移民局官员试图向她下达驱逐令。

example.ex: Police said they had been unable to serve a summons on 25-year-old Lee Jones.
example.tran: 警方说他们无法传唤 25 岁的李·琼斯。

entry.def: If you serve something such as a prison sentence or an apprenticeship, you spend a period of time doing it.

example.ex: ...Leo, who is currently serving a life sentence for murder...
example.tran: 因谋杀罪正在服无期徒刑的利奥

example.ex: He was able to serve his apprenticeship as a trainer with Eddie Futch.
example.tran: 他当时师从埃迪·富齐学当拳击教练员。

entry.def: When you serve in games such as tennis and badminton, you throw up the ball or shuttlecock and hit it to start play.
entry.tran: (在网球、羽毛球等比赛中)发球

example.ex: He served 17 double faults...
example.tran: 他有 17 次双发失误。

example.ex: If you serve like this nobody can beat you.
example.tran: 如果你像这样发球，没有人可以击败你。

entry.def: When you describe someone's serve, you are indicating how well or how fast they serve a ball or shuttlecock.

example.ex: His powerful serve was too much for the defending champion.
example.tran: 他的大力发球让卫冕冠军难以招架。

entry.def: If you say it serves someone right when something unpleasant happens to them, you mean that it is their own fault and you have no sympathy for them.
entry.tran: 咎由自取;罪有应得;活该

example.ex: Serves her right for being so stubborn.
example.tran: 她太固执了，活该。

means.word_mean: 1. (sports) a stroke that puts the ball in play;
1. serve a purpose, role, or function;

sentences.sentence: "The tree stump serves as a table"
"The female students served as a control group"

means.word_mean: 2. do duty or hold offices; serve in a specific function;

sentences.sentence: "He served as head of the department for three years"
"She served in Congress for two terms"
"The scandal served to increase his popularity"

means.word_mean: 4. be used by; as of a utility;

sentences.sentence: "The sewage plant served the neighboring communities"
"The garage served to shelter his horses"

means.word_mean: 5. help to some food; help with food or drink;

sentences.sentence: "I served him three times, and after that he helped himself"
"She dished out the soup at 8 P.M."
"The entertainers served up a lively show"

means.word_mean: 7. devote (part of) one's life or efforts to, as of countries, institutions, or ideas;
8. promote, benefit, or be useful or beneficial to;

sentences.sentence: "The President's wisdom has served the counrty well"

means.word_mean: 9. spend time in prison or in a labor camp;
10. work for or be a servant to;

sentences.sentence: "She attends the old lady in the wheelchair"
"Can you wait on our table, please?"
"The minister served the King for many years"

means.word_mean: 11. deliver a warrant or summons to someone;
12. be sufficient; be adequate, either in quality or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "A 'B' grade doesn't suffice to get me into medical school"
"My sons never served, because they are short-sighted"
"male animals serve the females for breeding purposes"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French servir, from Latin servire, from servus 'slave'
